title: The Making of a Logo
content:
Hey everybody,

I was inspired to create a “behind the scenes” gallery of my latest logo design project. Check it out and let me know what you all think!

[http://flickr.com/photos/bpotstra/sets/72157603466617860/detail/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080318093847/http:/flickr.com/photos/bpotstra/sets/72157603466617860/detail/ "http://flickr.com/photos/bpotstra/sets/72157603466617860/detail/")

Brian

author: bpotstra

comments.content: Very nice! I really need to go back and document some of my work better. Showing the progression like that is always nice.
Thanks for the compliment! I see alot of “work in progress sketches” for new typefaces, but never for any logo designs. I’m going to make a habit of doing this from now on too.

Thanks for posting this. I wish more people would. It was inspiring.

Sharon

Thanks for the educational flickr set, very inspiring and a great logo design. Lots of luck.  
Sam

Interesting! Great job!

———————————————————————————:  
Jean Chouinard (formerly emerjean on Typophile)
Thanks, this was helpful! It validates all steps I take between the brief and final solution.
Great work Brian! Also, lovely to see your ’Making of...’

I’ll be honest, I was a bit skeptical after seeing the initial sketches, but as the flickr set ended, my impression grew and grew. Very well done indeed.

I’ve shared this with some of my fellow designers for their reference as well. It’s also intriguing to see someone’s process spelled out like that.
Cool! I’ve been trying to piece together a similar documentation... but retroactively, and I keep missing pieces of paper (napkins?) I scrawled on and such. Thanks for sharing.
